commit.message:
Implement netifaces.interfaces() (#33)

This is part of netifaces compatibility layer I figured would be helpful
to people trying to avoid installing netifaces while still keeping their
netifaces-using code mostly intact.

commit.message:
Use environment marker for optional ipaddress dependency

This is needed to build universal wheels, otherwise the ipaddress
dependency in wheels is fixed at wheel building time and depends
on the single Python version used when building, which is not what
we want.

It's been reported in late 2018 that using environment markers breaks
installation from source distributions in presence of incompatible
setuptools version[1], but a lot of time passed since then and today
setuptools compatible with environment markers should be widely
available or possible to be installed. Also, since next releases will
be also distributed as wheels, the setuptools dependency is less
important since wheels work even with quite old setuptools,
only pip >= 1.4 is required[2].

[1] https://github.com/pydron/ifaddr/issues/14
[2] https://hynek.me/articles/conditional-python-dependencies/

verification.payload:
tree 0503685112c3204e05bd87b11e9df01254fb309f
parent 551aa97f530a557952104543022a7f9ce12c9582
author Jakub Stasiak <jakub@stasiak.at> 1591360335 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1591360335 +0200

It's been reported in late 2018 that using environment markers breaks

setuptools compatible with environment markers should be widely

commit.message:
Explicitly support only Python 2.7 and 3.5+

From what I see[1] there really aren't 3.2-3.4 users out there
downloading ifaddr from PyPi. There's significant number of 2.7
and 3.5 users, so we might as well keep compatibility with those
for now as it's not too difficult to do.

[1] https://pypistats.org/packages/ifaddr

verification.payload:
tree ef628e32dcd3e8476726e55be9d411f4c2d1f3c3
parent 87647e52edfd067d7a9119334d3cb8a463f3538e
author Jakub Stasiak <jakub@stasiak.at> 1591359796 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1591359796 +0200

Explicitly support only Python 2.7 and 3.5+

From what I see[1] there really aren't 3.2-3.4 users out there
downloading ifaddr from PyPi. There's significant number of 2.7
and 3.5 users, so we might as well keep compatibility with those
for now as it's not too difficult to do.

[1] https://pypistats.org/packages/ifaddr

commit.message:
Build universal wheels for simplicity (#29)

The project doesn't have any platform-specific native code so we might
as well build wheels that can be used everywhere.

This should allow installing the package on systems that can't install
the source distributions because of outdated setuptools.

verification.payload:
tree 9a534e0ed9189e0f435c01509667df1a2e883bc6
parent 2c9c1037afb1f1286521a52d2a1f2a75b7994101
author Jakub Stasiak <jakub@stasiak.at> 1591351940 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1591351940 +0200

Build universal wheels for simplicity (#29)

The project doesn't have any platform-specific native code so we might
as well build wheels that can be used everywhere.

This should allow installing the package on systems that can't install
the source distributions because of outdated setuptools.

commit.message:
Fix Illumos/Solaris compatibility

As reported in #23 by Jorge Schrauwen on Illumos/Solaris getifaddrs and
freeifaddrs live in libsocket instead of libc, let's handle that.
Update example
Fix whitespace

Expose interface index

Interface index is a relatively rarely used property of an adapter.
However, it is required for cases like joining an IPv6 multicast
group, and is very tricky to get on Windows. This small change makes
working with IPv6 multicast much easier.
Include license in sdist archive on pypi
Python3 compatibility for examples
Setup initial GitHub actions CI workflow (#25)

tree 2f64e5f82d5475709c3743821b7f50faf1df094a

commit.message: Preparing release 0.1.6
Keep using 'install_requires'. See https://packaging.python.org/discussions/install-requires-vs-requirements/

fixes installation of ipaddress module

A user had reported that the install_requires= line of the setup causes
issues #14. This update changes it so that the testing of the python
version happens in the ifaddr package and not in distutuls. This is a
far better way to go about it due to the very large number of distutils
and setup tools versions available. not all versions support the same
syntax or the install_requires as well. but all versions do
support requires= with a string for the module name or an empty list
if there are no dependencies. This will remove the need to add special
lines to handle specifically the setup tools version. This package has a
pretty simple setup routine, so there is no need to have requirements for
specific setup tools versions.

verification.payload:
tree 00f191712130e0b2c5bcaf19d1de616a752d798c
parent 3ae995ae1e219d88dae55c525d8c7d95fd4af661
author Kevin Schlosser <drschlosser@hotmail.com> 1544348254 -0700
committer Kevin Schlosser <drschlosser@hotmail.com> 1544348254 -0700

fixes installation of ipaddress module

A user had reported that the install_requires= line of the setup causes
issues #14. This update changes it so that the testing of the python
version happens in the ifaddr package and not in distutuls. This is a
far better way to go about it due to the very large number of distutils
and setup tools versions available. not all versions support the same
syntax or the install_requires as well. but all versions do
support requires= with a string for the module name or an empty list
if there are no dependencies. This will remove the need to add special
lines to handle specifically the setup tools version. This package has a
pretty simple setup routine, so there is no need to have requirements for
specific setup tools versions.

commit.message: Extended gabeguz's support for OpenBSD to other BSD derivatives.

Add OpenBSD support to ifaddr

This allows the `sockaddr_to_ip` call to work on
OpenBSD.  Before this patch, the call returns "None" and after it
returns the IP addresses associated with the interfaces.
Prepare release 0.1.5

commit.message:
Restrict ipaddress dependency to Python < 3.3

ifaddr depends on the ipaddress module. Before Python 3.3, ipaddress was
a separate module, but it’s now shipped with vanilla Python.

This means that from Python 3.3 onward, it’s not necessary to add
ipaddress as an install dependency anymore.

More than that, the explicit dependency is problematic, because users of
Python 3.3 and newer will get an error message. The reason is that
ipaddress won’t be found as a separate module anymore, even though it’s
implicitly available.

This patch restricts the ipaddress install dependency to Python versions
before 3.3. In this way, users of Python earlier than 3.3 will still be
required to get the ipaddress module backport, whereas users of newer
Python versions won’t be bothered with error messages.

verification.payload:
tree 594c2e49295a599fa2f55a3bad53f4172929192a
parent e6163693b6b6d85aad711c3a6849ce7e3bc80d01
author Patrick Lühne <patrick@luehne.de> 1543354516 +0100
committer Patrick Lühne <patrick@luehne.de> 1543354628 +0100

Restrict ipaddress dependency to Python < 3.3

ifaddr depends on the ipaddress module. Before Python 3.3, ipaddress was
a separate module, but it’s now shipped with vanilla Python.

This means that from Python 3.3 onward, it’s not necessary to add
ipaddress as an install dependency anymore.

More than that, the explicit dependency is problematic, because users of
Python 3.3 and newer will get an error message. The reason is that
ipaddress won’t be found as a separate module anymore, even though it’s
implicitly available.

This patch restricts the ipaddress install dependency to Python versions
before 3.3. In this way, users of Python earlier than 3.3 will still be
required to get the ipaddress module backport, whereas users of newer
Python versions won’t be bothered with error messages.
